column2: CALIFORNIA DMV PRACTICE TEST
column4: California
column6: CA

column2: Question Text
column4: Answer1 Text
column6: Answer2 Text
column8: Answer3 Text

column2: 1. To make a right turn onto a two-way street from a two-way street, start in the right-hand lane and end in:
column4: any lane that is available.
column6: the left lane.
column8: the lane closest to the curb.

column2: 2. Pedestrians crossing at corners have the right-of-way:
column4: only when a crosswalk is painted on the street.
column6: whether or not a crosswalk is marked.
column8: only at open intersections.

column2: 3. All of the following are dangerous while driving. Which is also illegal:
column4: Having one or more interior lights on.
column6: Wearing a headset that covers both ears.
column8: Using cruise control on residential streets.

column2: 4. When you see a NEV ROUTE sign, you should watch out for:
column4: a Nevada law enforcement officer.
column6: slow-moving vehicles in the roadway.
column8: animal-drawn vehicles.

column2: 5. Who must wear seat belts?
column4: The driver and all passengers under the age of 21.
column6: The driver and all passengers 8 years of age or older, or children who are 4 feet 9 inches tall or taller.
column8: The driver and front seat passengers.

column2: 6. The traffic light is green and you want to drive straight through an intersection. If a car is already in the intersection and is making a turn, you must:
column4: enter the intersection and then stop.
column6: drive through the intersection. You have the right-of-way.
column8: let that car complete its turn before you enter the intersection.

column2: 7. You want to make a right turn at an upcoming intersection. You should slow down and:
column4: avoid driving in the bicycle lane.
column6: move toward the left side of your lane.
column8: signal for 100 feet before turning.

column2: 8. It is a very windy day. You are driving and a dust storm blows across the freeway reducing your visibility. You should drive slower and turn on your:
column4: Interior lights.
column6: Headlights.
column8: Parking lights.

column2: 9. At intersections without ‘Stop’ or ‘Yield’ signs, you must:
column4: yield to the vehicle or bicycle that arrives first.
column6: treat the intersection as if it was a roundabout.
column8: yield to the vehicle on your left if it reaches the intersection at the same time as you.

column2: 10. Which of these statements about drugs and traffic is true?
column4: Even over-the-counter drugs can impair your driving.
column6: Any prescription drug is safe to use if you don’t feel drowsy.
column8: Only illegal drugs can impair your driving.

column2: 11. What is the first thing to do when you make a three-point turn?
column4: Signal with your left turn signal, then check carefully for traffic coming toward you.
column6: Turn left, go across the road so you come to a stop while you face the edge of the road.
column8: Signal with your right turn signal, then pull over to the right and stop.

column2: 12. What do pennant-shaped signs indicate?
column4: A school crossing
column6: A No Passing Zone
column8: Yield

column2: 13. You must stop at the intersection ahead. Just before the intersection, you have to cross railroad tracks. You should stop before you cross the railroad tracks when:
column4: you don’t have room to completely cross the tracks.
column6: the crossing is located in a city or town with frequent train traffic.
column8: you transport two or more children in a passenger vehicle.

column2: 14. A school bus has stopped ahead on your side of the road and is flashing its red lights. What should you do?
column4: Stop until all the children have crossed your lane.
column6: Stop as long as the red lights flash.
column8: Stop first, then proceed when you think it is safe.

column2: 15. What is a likely effect when you take another drug while you drink alcohol?
column4: There are no effects, unless the drug is prescription only.
column6: If the drug is over-the-counter, there are no effects.
column8: The effects of the alcohol and the drug are enhanced.

column2: 16. When parking on a public road, drivers should:
column4: move as far away from traffic as possible.
column6: always park on the left side of the roadway.
column8: All of the above.

column2: 17. Blind spots around a large vehicle are _________________ than the blind spots around a car.
column4: larger and deeper
column6: narrower and shorter
column8: less dangerous

column2: 18. Unless otherwise posted, the speed limit in a business district is:
column4: 35 MPH
column6: 30 MPH
column8: 25 MPH

column2: 19. At intersections without “Stop” or “Yield” signs, you must:
column4: yield to traffic and pedestrians already in the intersection.
column6: yield to the vehicle on your right if it reaches the intersection at the same time as you.
column8: All of the above.

column2: 20. You are approaching a green traffic light, but traffic is blocking the intersection. What is the best thing to do?
column4: Partially enter the intersection to establish your right-of-way.
column6: Continue into the intersection and wait for traffic to clear.
column8: Don’t enter the intersection until you can get completely across.

column2: 21. You are driving on the freeway behind a large truck. You should drive:
column4: Farther behind the truck than for a passenger vehicle.
column6: To the right side of the truck and wait to pass.
column8: Closer behind the truck than for a passenger vehicle.

column2: 22. What should drivers do in case of a brake failure?
column4: Tie a white cloth on the left door handle.
column6: Brake lightly.
column8: Shift to a lower gear.

column2: 23. Parking is not allowed:
column4: in a tunnel.
column6: on the road side of a parked vehicle.
column8: All of the above.

column2: 24. The “three-second rule” applies to the space ______ of your vehicle.
column4: to the sides
column6: ahead
column8: in the back

column2: 25. How can you prevent fatigue on a long trip?
column4: Get enough sleep.
column6: Plan to drive long trips with a companion.
column8: All of the above.

column2: 26. Which of the following increases your chances of having a collision?
column4: Continuously changing lanes to pass other vehicles.
column6: Adjusting your rearview mirror before you start driving.
column8: Looking over your shoulder while making lane changes.

column2: 27. What is the first thing you should do if your wheels move off the pavement?
column4: Ease your foot off the gas pedal and brake gently.
column6: Pull over to the right and sound your horn to warn the other drivers.
column8: Pull the steering wheel back.

column2: 28. When driving on a slippery surface such as snow or ice:
column4: pump your brakes to keep them from freezing.
column6: shift to a low gear before going down steep hills.
column8: maintain traction by following other vehicles closely.

column2: 29. If you are riding a vehicle equipped with a lap belt and a separate shoulder belt, you are:
column4: required to use both the lap and shoulder belt.
column6: only required to use the shoulder belt.
column8: only required to use the lap belt.

column2: 30. You face a green light, but traffic on the other side of the intersection does not allow you to travel all the way through the intersection. What must you do?
column4: Wait for the next green light.
column6: Wait until traffic ahead clears, so you do not block the intersection.
column8: Enter the intersection and wait until traffic ahead clears.

column2: 31. A flashing yellow light:
column4: warns drivers to proceed with caution.
column6: is used at dangerous intersections.
column8: All of the above.

column2: 32. A red arrow pointing to the right on a traffic light means you may:
column4: turn in that direction after you come to a complete stop.
column6: turn in that direction after slowing and checking traffic.
column8: not turn in that direction until the light turns green.

column2: 33. Driving under the influence of any medication which impairs your driving is permitted:
column4: under no circumstances.
column6: if the medication was prescribed by a physician.
column8: if your car is regularly insured.

column2: 34. It is illegal for a person 21 years of age or older to operate a vehicle with a blood alcohol concentration (BAC) of _____ or higher.
35. Which of the following is true about safety belts?
column4: They can reduce injuries and deaths.
column6: They can trap you inside a vehicle.
column8: They are not necessary when driving around town.

column2: 36. Which of the following should NOT be done when driving near pedestrians:
column4: Drive on a sidewalk.
column6: Pass a vehicle that has stopped at a crosswalk.
column8: All of the above.
